comment.author: 72646284@N00
comment._content: www.thevarsity.ca/view/print/1543-inventing-the-aqualung Dialog from this webpage stating how Maurice Fernez' device was inspiration for further advances in breathing apparatus. In 1912, Le Prieur watched as Maurice Fernez remained underwater through the aid of a surface pump. Inspired by Fernez’s display, Le Prieur wanted to find a way to do the same thing underwater. Fourteen years later, the two men teamed up and produced the lightweight breathing apparatus that Jacques Cousteau would later refine and popularize.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: A photo on the 3rd page image (the page is numbered 23) of www.hdsitalia.com/articoli/31_fernez.pdf looks as though it could have been taken the same day. That photo is captioned as taken on August 20, 1912, on the Seine, presumably in Paris. This article about Fernez is in Italian, freely translated from the French by Philippe Rousseau.
